comment: Dr. Goldberg is a professor that truly cares about his students. His intuition has made his class interesting and enjoyable. He knows how to deliver a lecture thats interesting, quick, and to the point.

Not bad! History can be boring (obviously) but his lectures aren't that bad. Also participation matters!!! If you don't talk in class make sure you do online posts! It will help your grade!! Just had a midterm and final, but got to exempt final!

He was a really good professor. I enjoyed his class a lot. IF you want an A, which isn't hard to get, just make sure to take good notes in class . Do not plan to just study his puts for the test because there is minimal information on each slide. The book is not really mandatory because he bases his tests on his lectures, not the book. great teach!

Professor Goldberg is an awesome professor. He is funny and his lectures are intriguing. Not many grades in this class. Midterm and final are based off of lecture notes and book, not PPTs and are difficult if you dont take good notes. Participate in class and show up for all in class work and youll do fine. Also do the daily readings to do well.
Thought I would hate the class, but loved it. PARTICIPATE. He likes it when students participate. Would take again.

His lectures can be lengthy but he puts the power points online. Only a midterm and a final. You respond to short questions in class sometimes which count as in class assignments. Make sure to participate in class because it counts. If you make an A on the midterm (with curve), participate, and complete all assignments , you can exempt the final.

Do yourself a favor and take this man. Show up, do ok on the midterm and you will get an a. I hate history and made an a. If you participate (raise hand or online disscusion posts) frequently and do ok on the midterm he will exempt you from the final. Only the mid term and final with participation as overall grade. He's so easy. Take him.

He is the type of teacher you want. No the tests aren't online like others, but the class is simple. Just come and show interest. He really respects his students that show attentivness and participate. Lets face it, World History isnt the most entertaining class in the whole world but Goldberg will deffinitely make the process less painful.

I found this class very easy. Going to class is a must. Take down as much as you can from his lecture because his tests are mainly what he says in lecture. There will be like 3 questions not mentioned in lecture on the tests. I don't like history, but I did learn a lot from this class and he's a super nice guy!

Takes attendance quizzes so it's important to be in class if you want the grade. Tests are hard, and lectures are long and boring. If you want an easy pass I would recommend taking a teacher who does online tests (not this one). You need to study a lot if you want to pass the class.

He is a good professor just boring. You really only need to go to class for the attendance quizzes. I don't like history so this was not my favorite class but he made it easy with study guides and posting the power points online.
He's a nice guy. Does do attendance quizzes, but as long as you go to class, you basically get a 100 on them. We had a map quiz, midterm, and a final. Pretty easy A.

He was an incredible professor! I took his 7 week 3 hour Tuesday Thursday class and absolutely loved it. He makes jokes in-between his lectures and gives you breaks. If you don't understand anything, he'll gladly slow down and explain. And comes midterms, he will help you out if you stay after!!! Loved him!!!! TAKE HIM

So far my favorite professor in college. He is a really nice guy and truly enjoys history. I don't like history at all and I enjoyed his course. You dont really have to take notes or use the text book. There 2 test consisting of 10 short answer and one response, gives a study guide that is the same exact questions as the test. Easy A

I took this class over summer. lecture dryer than the desert. Test were in class easy set up 10 multi choice 5 identifications that you choose from a list of 20 one essay. Attendance quizzes are taken every class. Never paid attention made a B. DIDNT use book I googled every thing on study guide. Overall nice. Easy class

Be ready to read your book! I did not like his style. All tests are online and I used my book and still made C's! Like the quizzes that are basically attendance checks, and the final was an essay, but otherwise his lectures didn't ever match his slides. If you are good at history it should be easy, but otherwise pick someone else.

Best professor of the semester. I got an A! Test are online, book is used, powerpoints are used, He is very clear in presenting material. Class isn't mandatory but you get random "quizzes", which are mostly just free writing. If you want an A take this class!

This is one of my first A+ in any of my history class in high school and in college. He is a very good teacher and the study guides are similar to the test. Your attends are your quiz grade (easy 100). He use PowerPoint in his lecture. We even went to Kennesaw State Holocaust museum. If you are bad or decent in history. YOU NEED TO TAKE HIM.

If you want an easy A take this class! I didn't take notes or pay attention and made an A. 2 exams are online and taken on your own time. Attendance quizzes given so make sure to go to class. The final is optional. Lecture is boring so bring a laptop and sit in the back.

Professor Goldberg was great!There are "quizzes" (that are basically just an attendance check) and if you miss the it goes in as a zero, so try to be in class.  The tests were online and open note, but with a time limit. The final is an essay, but was optional if you were happy with the grade you had before the final.

His lectures are kinda boring. But his test are online, therefore you can use your resources to help you pass. Only 2 test. Fairly hard, but not unbearable. He curves both test. Final exam is an essay, but we give you the topic beforehand. 10 quizzes, 3 points each. I knew nothing about History, but made 100's on all the quizzes. Common sense stuff

Great class! I took it at 8am and it was hard to pay attention sometimes. Besides that, his tests are kinda hard, but if you read the book and pay attention in class, you'll be fine. He does random quizzes that don't count much to take attendance; they only count 3 points. Oh, and he also curves tests a lot and gives extra credit.
